name: Development Cycle Meta-Router V1

stages.name: Request Classification
stages.description: Classify user request as bug fix, feature request, refactor, or question

decisions.description: Request is a simple code modification

stages.name: Bug Fix Pipeline
stages.description: Execute bug-fix-v1 pipeline for bug fixes

stages.name: Quick Code Change
stages.description: Handle simple, direct code modifications (1-5 lines)

stages.name: Feature Development Pipeline
stages.description: Execute feature-development-v1 pipeline for new features

stages.name: Handle Question
stages.description: Answer user questions about code or system

connections.description: Bug detected, route to bug-fix pipeline
Simple change requested, use direct code implementer
Feature requested, route to feature-development pipeline
Bug fix pipeline complete - PIPELINE ENDS
Feature development pipeline complete - PIPELINE ENDS

userContext: Continue implementing persistent ship fitting between webpage reloads. The previous attempt was stuck trying to use auto-save intervals. Instead, implement a simpler approach: save the ship fitting state immediately whenever the player fits or removes an item from their ship. This means adding save calls directly to the fit/remove action handlers. The save should store which items are fitted to the ship and their positions/slots, and restore this state when the page reloads. Focus on the immediate save-on-action approach rather than periodic auto-saving.

results.classify_request:
```json
{
  "classification": "FEATURE_REQUEST",
  "confidence": 0.90,
  "reasoning": "This is a request to implement persistent ship fitting functionality. While it mentions a 'previous attempt', the core request is to ADD persistence functionality that saves/restores ship fitting state across page reloads. The user is specifying implementation details (save-on-action vs auto-save intervals), but the fundamental ask is implementing a new feature: state persistence for ship fittings. This is not a bug fix (nothing is broken), not a quick change (requires new logic, storage handling, and restoration logic), and not a refactor (adding new behavior, not improving existing code structure).",
  "context": {
    "originalRequest": "Continue implementing persistent ship fitting between webpage reloads. The previous attempt was stuck trying to use auto-save intervals. Instead, implement a simpler approach: save the ship fitting state immediately whenever the player fits or removes an item from their ship. This means adding save calls directly to the fit/remove action handlers. The save should store which items are fitted to the ship and their positions/slots, and restore this state when the page reloads. Focus on the immediate save-on-action approach rather than periodic auto-saving.",
```

DECISION: FEATURE_REQUEST
